item.description:
Morgarhum Market is a 2-player mini game played with a deck of 18 cards. In the game, players are rival traders in the fictional market town of Morgarhum.

Players will draw and play cards representing goods of different values such as weapons, food, drink and accessories. Each goods card also has an action that is activated when played, allowing players to do such things as conceal goods, alter the value of goods on the market, or to have certain goods confiscated.

Additional powerful abilities are available by bribing town officials and players must decide when or if to activate these.

Players compete over three rounds to have the highest value goods on their market stall, with each round representing a day of trading.

—description form the publisher

Game of battles with miniatures. Quick and easy rules to play immediately. The game comes with a book with the basic rules and lists of fighters. It is proposed as a cooperative game, in which different players (or only one) face an automated and undaunted enemy that does not know surrender.

—description from the designer

A new business-themed game that moves fast with fun strategy. Add a fantasy sci-fi themed version called Monster — Zombies, Vampires, Orcs, Merfolk, Werewolves, and Dragons — and you have the GoVenture Card Game.

The GoVenture Card Game is fast and easy to play but deep in strategy. It is designed for novice and experienced players, kids and adults, to have fun playing together.

The depth of the gameplay is revealed as you play. Follow every turn and every decision, or just play casually.

Play with 2 players, or up to 6, in a single game. Includes over 300 cards with engaging graphics and game rules that are easy to read and follow. Each game plays for 10 to 30 minutes (or longer with 6 players). More ways to play are included on the game website at GoVentureCardGame.com

_________________________________
GAMEPLAY SUMMARY - MONSTER THEME


 There are four decks of cards: MONSTERS (6 types), WEAPONS, BOUNTY, ACTION.
 Earn GOLD COINS by delivering MONSTERS to claim BOUNTIES. To claim a BOUNTY, you must hold matching WEAPON, MONSTER, and BOUNTY cards.
 The winner is the first player to have 20 GOLD COINS on hand or to collect all 3 unique WORLD cards. WORLD cards are earned when you claim BOUNTIES for the MONSTERS shown on the cards.


ON YOUR TURN


 Pick up one MONSTER card from the deck or top discard. This is the START of your turn. 
 Do any of the following (no limit): Trade cards with other players; Buy or return WEAPONS cards; Buy or play ACTION cards.
 Pick up one MONSTER or BOUNTY card (or the top discard of either deck). Claim the BOUNTY if you can, otherwise return the BOUNTY card to the top of the discard pile. This is the END of your turn.


_________________________________
GAMEPLAY SUMMARY - ENTREPRENEUR THEME


 There are four decks of cards: PRODUCTS (6 types), BUSINESSES, CUSTOMERS, ACTION.
 Earn MONEY by selling PRODUCTS to CUSTOMERS. To make a sale, you must hold matching BUSINESS, PRODUCT, and CUSTOMER cards.
 The winner is the first player to have $20 (MONEY) on hand or to collect all 3 unique WORLD cards. WORLD cards are earned when you make sales of the PRODUCTS shown on the cards.


ON YOUR TURN


 Pick up one PRODUCT card from the deck or top discard. This is the START of your turn. 
 Do any of the following (no limit): Trade cards with other players; Buy or return BUSINESS cards; Buy or play ACTION cards.
 Pick up one PRODUCT or CUSTOMER card (or the top discard of either deck). Make a sale if you can, otherwise return the CUSTOMER card to the top of the discard pile. This is the END of your turn.


—description from the publisher

A simple card game for kids. Cards show images of figures in different occupations (fireman, clown, diver etc) - and there are between 1 and 4 of each occupation in the deck.

Place out any card from your hand next to any others already out - in vertical or horizontal lines. If your card is the same as the card at the other end of the row or column, take the whole line.

Try to win the most cards.

—user summary

A simple tile placement game; 27 planet tiles are piled in a random heap on the table and players take turns selecting one that has no other tile on top of it and placing it in their "galaxy."

Planet tiles each have three characteristics: size, color, and type. Once the tiles are taken as evenly as possible players score for lines of three planets which share a characteristic.

—user summary

You've never played UNO like this before! Now with a Jurassic World theme, the rules are similar to those of regular UNO Attack, but this game features the "Attack! Attack!" command card that offers an exciting and unpredictable way to play UNO. If you draw that card you’ll have to push the button on the Dilophosaurus shooter, and you’ll either be the target of a stream of UNO Attack Jurassic World cards, or you will get lucky and nothing will happen! But if you’re not so lucky, the shooter will fire a stream of cards that you have to add to your hand! And when the shooter is launching cards, it makes a variety of funny sounds that add energy and silliness to the game. UNO Attack Jurassic World adds speed and surprise to the game because you never know when an attack is coming! The goal is still to get rid of all the cards in your hand, and when you’re down to one card, don’t forget to yell, “UNO!” Contains 112 cards, Dilophosaurus shooter, and instructions. The unit is both portable and designed to help with storage—you can keep the cards right inside the shooter!

Now Jurassic World fans can play a special version of UNO Attack!:
The "Attack! Attack!" card - When this card is played, whoever played it gets to call any color and then choose ANY OTHER PLAYER in the game to “Attack.” The Dilophosaurus Card Launcher is rotated to face the chosen player, and then “attacking” player gets to press down on the Dilophosaur’s nose twice. The player being “attacked” must keep all the cards that come out of the launcher. The game then continues with the next player in regular rotation (the second player to the left – or right in Reverse rotation - of the player who played the Wild Attack-Attack card).

The goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand, and the first player or team to 500 wins. When you’re down to one card, don’t forget to yell “UNO”!

—description from the publisher

The grape pickers are fighting to inherit a magnificent but nearly abandoned vineyard. Whoever is able to harvest the best grape yield from the vines will become the owner of this precious land.

The players advance along the board, collecting cards with the most interesting grapes. To collect the cards you advance along a track that represents the rows of a vineyard. Each track has a series of different grape cards on either side, and you are allowed to choose the cards next to the space you are on, or next to the space you move to. Each turn you can choose a card and advance or advance and choose a card.

At the end of the track, there are different wineries (each preferring a different kind of grape variety). Get the best reward for your harvest from the local wineries by matching your hand of grapes with their needs. If the players go quickly, they may get the best cards, but risk not having enough grapes. If they go too slow, the competition can beat them to the best vines!

Selling your grapes to the wineries gets the players prestige points, and each player has a limited amount of deliveries. The end game triggers when a player makes their last grape delivery. The other players can finish moving through their track. Then, everyone counts their prestige points gained through their previous deliveries, and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Paris: La cité de la lumière

item.description:
Paris is a 2-player board game by José Antonio Abascal infused with Parisian aesthetics by the boardgame’s artist Oriol Hernández. The game is set in late 19th century Paris during the 1889 “Exposition Universelle,” or world’s fair, when public electricity was a hot topic. Electricity spread throughout the city, creating today’s beautiful nocturnal Parisian streets and coining Paris’s nickname “La Cité de la Lumiére”, the city of lights.

The most well-lit buildings are admired more highly by passers-by. In the first phase, players can either place tiles or grow their reserve of buildings. The cobblestone tiles are divided into 4 random spaces (their color, their opponents’ color, a streetlight or a mixed-color space where either player can build).

Then, in the second phase, players build on top of their color or the mixed spaces, in effort to position their buildings as close to as many streetlights as possible. More streetlights solicit more adoration and points. The player with the best lit buildings steals the hearts of Parisian pedestrians and wins the game.

—description from the publisher

link.value: テンデイズゲームズ (Ten Days Games)

item.description:
The pantry shelves are nearly overflowing with food and the mice are rushing to collect what they need to ensure their families have enough to eat through the harsh winter. Each family forages for themselves, trying to do the best for the wee offspring. The first to fill their little sack will be the envy of all mousedom.

Ratzzia is a game for two to five players. The dice represent the mice in each player’s family. Each time they roll the dice they must arrange the die results on the board in order to get as much food as possible.

Each player has their own set of colored dice. On their turn, they roll their dice and choose to place them on the matching spaces on the board. The dice represent mice climbing on top of each other in order to get rewards from the top shelf.

Rewards can be delicious food, or actions that help you store or steal food. After collecting some food, it needs to be stored, otherwise it can be stolen by other players! As soon as a player gets 25 points worth of food, they win the game and survive the winter!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
According to Plutarch, a seer had warned that harm would come to Caesar no later than the Ides of March. On his way to the Theatre of Pompey, where he would be assassinated, Caesar passed the seer and joked, "The Ides of March are come", implying that the prophecy had not been fulfilled, to which the seer replied "Aye, Caesar; but not gone."

Players are members of the Senate and must plot in favor or against the magnicide of Julius Caesar. But is not that easy, they need to identify who shares their convictions in order to partnership against the other players, and be careful with whom only look for their wealth.

There are four roles that are dealt every turn: 

 The "Consul" take the decision of who will play in the active round and distribute the rest of the roles.
 There are two "Edils" that will vote, secretly, if the Caesar will life or die.
 At last, the "Praetor" will decide to sneak a peek one of the two votes and can force that "Edil" to change his vote.




Once all the players voted twice, they reveal his votes and check if the Caesar will live or die.

But the decisions are not that easy. At the beginning of the game, players will take two different cards of their "team" (in favor, against, or to be neutral in the "magnicide") and they must discard one of these cards before the second round of votes take place in order to choose their final team.

—description from the designer

item.description:
For the 20th anniversary of Roads & Boats, it is being reprinted for the 5th time. This edition will include the expansion, &Cetera, so it can be played with up to 6 players and you will get all the additional modules of &Cetera included in the game. There are no other changes to the game.

In Roads & Boats, each player builds a civilization over a long period of time, like in many other games. Unlike most games, however, the emphasis is not on warfare, population growth, city or statebuilding, but on logistics, or rather: on transport.

Each player starts the game with three donkeys, a pile of wooden boards, a number of stones and two geese. With these few resources, you try to build such diverse things as woodcutters, roads, boats, mines, a stock exchange... but beware! There is no concept of territory in this game: you cannot own land, nor buildings, so the things you build can be used by any other player...

The original game can be played by two to four players, but it can also be used as a one-person puzzle.

&Cetera adds new buildings, new goods, new land types, new transporters, new ways to win and new strategies. It also includes 24 new scenarios and material to play with 5 or 6 players. & Cetera contains all the rules and material previously published as Planes & Trains, plus a lot more.

- from publisher
A dice game in a tube, where the dice have a scorpion instead of the 1. The object is to get the highest score after 3 turns.

Brexit: The Real Deal is a card game in which 3-5 players compete to win trade deals with other countries. You'll have to plan, bluff and second guess what everyone is doing as you try and complete your hidden agenda and stop them completing theirs!

Myshtea: The Fall is a cooperative territorial defense game for 2-4 players by Martino Chiacchiera and Marta Ciaccasassi. In this title a cataclysm has hit Mysthea, making the five floating islands to fall down on the lands of Icaion.

The two civilizations finally meet for the first time and are immediately forced to cooperate to stop the advance of frenzied creatures, attracted by the giant crystal inside the City.

This game can be played just by combining together components from Mysthea and Icaion.

—description from the publisher

Unlike the classic card game, Mau Mau - the board game is not just about getting rid of your cards quickly and saying Mau Mau - it's about get as many points as possible. Shouting Mau Mau doesn't end the game, but gives you 5 bonus points. Playing identical cards and some special spaces also wins bonus points. The game ends when all the spaces on the board are covered with cards. The winner of this fast-paced board game version of the classic card game is the player who scored the most points!
—description from the back of the box

Draw two on the 7, skip a turn on the 8 - the famous card game mau mau gets its own special charm as a board game. Anyway, if Reiner Knizia takes over the implementation.

Placing a suitable card on another, the next player must react - this is the classic principle of mau mau. The suit or number must match the previously placed card. Reiner Knizia has transferred this principle to the game board: tiles are placed on a path. The color or symbol shown must match the adjacent tile. Special fields provide surprise effects. And the classics such as "two draw" or "skip" are also present here. For the penultimate card, announce "mau"; for the last card, "mau mau" also applies. However: "mau mau" is not the end. But only when all fields on the map are occupied. This creates tension: the winner is not who got rid of his cards first, but who has collected the most points.

So it is important to proceed strategically and reach the special fields, because they certainly lead to the coveted point chips. In addition, you usually have several investment options.

—description form the publisher (translated)

Dicey Crafting is a single player, dungeon crawling, dice rolling adventure game.

The gameplay consists of a deck of monsters that you must battle your way through to complete the game. You also have a weapon (how you attack) and a shield (your health) that are crafted out of dice. These gear pieces lose durability (the number decreases on them) as you attack enemies and they attack you. As a gear piece wears out you can 'mine' dice from a dice mine, roll them, and re-craft your weapon.

Game time is between 30 to 45 mins. You can build the monster deck smaller for a shorter game.

—description from the designer

The Phantom: Treasures of Drakon is a character driven race through a temple to hoard treasure to save them from the sinking island.

You will encounter hidden traps, sacred rooms and of course your nemesis.

Players use available action points to plan their way through the temple. Your hand of cards can aid your plans to steal items from other players, move faster or down hidden routes, avoid traps.

Each player has a custom dice, player board, unique player power and mini to move around the board.

The game is won by accumulating the most Victory Points, and the game ends at a pre-determined amount of rounds organised at the start. The rounds are arranged in the form of a comic strip.

A set of miniature war game rules dealing with battles in Western Europe from 1494 to 1529. Includes rules for moving miniatures, firing weapons, morale and fighting in melee. The goal is to defeat your opponent through superior tactics. There are several army lists provided. The Army Lists are: Early English, Late English, Florentine, Early French, Late French, Holy Roman Empire, 
Spanish Holy Roman Empire, Irish, Italian Independent City State, Milanese, Neapolitan, Borgia Papal, Papal, Scottish, Early Spanish, Late Spanish, Swiss Confederation and Venetian.

—user summary

This is a roll-and-move board game, which merges the gameplay of Monopoly with Casino "mini-games."

On a player's turn, they roll two dice and move clock-wise around a board, and take the action of the spot they land on.

If a player lands on a property, and it is unowned, they may purchase it. If it is owned, then they must play the owner rent money.

If they land on "Tough Luck" and "Jackpot" card spots, the player takes a card from the corresponding card pile and follows the instructions on the chosen card.

The unique aspect of the game is that if you land on a "Casino" spot, then the player plays a Casino "mini-game." There are four mini-games: Roulette, Black Jack, Craps, and slots. (The game comes with a small roulette wheel, and dice to replicate slot machines.) Players can place bets on these games.

The first player to reach $35,000 (or the person with the most money after a set amount of time) is the winner.

—user summary

name.value: Top That! The Get To Know You Game

item.description:
The card game Top That! is a new type of game that takes the process of getting to know your fellow human and makes it a fun, often insightful, experience. The game is meant to appeal to just about anyone from any background, and can be used as an ice breaker or as a tool to get people to open up.

Top That! is a deck of cards where each card has a topic on it. Along with each topic, there's a caption that is meant to spark ideas for responses to the topic, or in many cases the caption is just meant to get a chuckle out of the players to help lighten to mood. Topics are things like, "Your Worst Day at School", where each person is expected to recount their worst day at school story. The game has some hidden strategies, where it's not always about what stories are told, but sometimes how entertaining they are when told.

At the end of each round of game play, each player votes for their favorite response without voting on their own, and the person with the most votes wins the round. If there's a tie, then you have a tiebreaker round between those that tied, responding to a new topic card. The game continues until you hit a predetermined number of cards, or you all call it quits.

—description from the designer

The deadliest martial arts experts have gathered in a secret arena to engage the ultimate stealth assassin showdown. As each is evenly matched in strength, skill, and speed, only cunning and courage will tell who will be the last one standing.

Ninjas!! The Stealth Assassin Showdown is a battle royale board game for 2 to 4 players, who use deduction to find and strike moving opponents while trying to evade attacks themselves.

The game is played on a 10-by-10 grid, and involves playable Move and Attack cards, as well as Ninja Star and Footprint tokens. Each player begins with the same hand of 12 cards--the 12 Styles of Ninja, which depict and describe the strategies in the ninja's toolbox, and which can be used to help find, hit, or dodge opponents. Turns alternate between Moves and Attacks, in which all players plan secretly, and then reveal and resolve simultaneously. Players record their own turns and track evidence of their opponents' movements in writing on a Notepad.

Although the in-game goals remain the same for every game of Ninjas!!, players can change the end-game conditions to allow for different game times and styles of gameplay. The standard game involved 3 wounds and player elimination, other options include Sudden Death matches as well as point-based games in which players count the number of successful attacks against the number of times they were wounded. Each game of Ninjas!! can also be played on a differently laid out board and with different starting positions.

-description from publisher

name.value: Borderlands: Tiny Tina's Robot Tea Party

item.description:
Borderlands: Tiny Tina's Robot Tea Party is a light card game for 2-5 players, suitable for ages 13+. The players take on the role of Vault Hunters attending one of Tiny Tina's famous tea parties. For fun, they engage in a friendly competition to see who can be the first to assemble a Claptrap. The deck contains hats, arms, and wheels of various skins (Wizard, Sheriff, Pirate, Gentleman, and classic CL4P-TP) as well as action cards that help you find parts for your Claptrap, remove unwanted parts from your Claptrap, or catch up by removing parts from other players' Claptraps. The two player game takes about 10 minutes, and each additional player adds 5-8 minutes.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Set in a post apocalyptic world destroyed by climate change, Tremor is a 2 to 4 player medium weight strategy game where you redesign and rearrange the board every turn. As an animal spirit guide, to win you must exploit a disaster-ridden world to help your species progress, while hindering your opponents. The goal is to save your species by helping them reach their last remaining natural habitat in the opposite corner of the board, before your rivals get to theirs.
â€‹
Tremor is played on a modular tile board. On your turn you must take 3 actions in any order: Traverse, Tectonic Twist, and Scout (a choice of component actions Explore and Forecast).

These actions allow players to move across the board towards their goal, reorient tiles, and accumulate Tremor Tokens. Tremor Tokens are placed on the separate Catastrophe Board, and players must strategically allocate and optimise them to ignite a disaster.

There are 6 disasters that will help or hinder your passage to safety. Each of them have unique effects, and the area of the board they affect is based on how you manipulate their position and orientation. You can also evade, combo and amplify their effects by using secret Catastrophe Cards, Disaster Die rolls, and abilities unique to your species.

Tremor can be played as a competitive or co-operative game. It's easy to learn and hard to master, making it suitable for all skill levels. Games last between 30-90 minutes depending on how seriously you take your strategy.

— Jonah, Curly Bros Games

Onslaught is a fantasy, military unit card game for 2-6 players. Your hand makes up your army and it's you vs everyone else. Using your dice rolls and card special abilities to knock out opponent cards, while withering their retaliation. Can you survive the Onslaught? The last player with any remaining cards gains a victory. Play goes till one champion emerges with two victories.

Players choose between 2 styles of play every time there's a new hand. Either Offense or Defense. Each gives a player unique powers and abilities. This mixed with the card special abilities grants a wide range of tactical options. Players can play to their cards, the benefits of a style or their personal preferences. Each hand comes with many diverse possibilities.

Ready to join the battleground? Many may enter, but only one survives the Onslaught!

—description from the publisher

In the colorful chamber of the Castle of Mind, two players clash. The players command colored pawns on the stone floor of the castle. The goal is to reach the middle of the field with the red pawn - and to stop the opponent from doing the same.

The game holds many opportunities. It is up to the players’ decisions, what roles their pawns fulfill, where and when they strike, how they defend and how they switch tactics during the battle.

What makes the encounter especially exciting, is the unique game mechanism, which enables that movement and conflict does not happen at the same place. 
This simple but brilliant twist in the gameplay requires that the players’ attention covers the whole board and to try to think ahead of the opponent, keeping several versions in mind. This stimulates the players to think and to develop their thinking.

Thus the encounter takes place in the minds of the two players. The colored pawns commanded on the colorful floor of the castle of mind represent this challenge.

The Castle of Mind is a two-player logic-strategy board game where players move colored pieces on a board of colored fields, aiming to eliminate the enemy's red pieces while reaching the red field in the middle of the board with one of their own red piece. The game's specialty is it's game mechanic: the strike by a piece to another does not happen where the actual move occurs!

—description from the publisher

Theme

A Strategic fantasy medieval cards game for 2-8 players, all against all or cooperative.

"Throne is a game of duels, betrayals and false alliances to contend the Throne for world domination. Ancient Guilds will face each other in epic fights without exclusion of sword blow, they will have to defend themselves from the attacks of threatening Dragons and will be able to find comfort with great drinks of good Wine! Will you have the necessary valor to reach the Legendary Kalesh and face its Guardians? What will your destiny reserve? This will depend only on you!"

Game Play

Starting from the youngest player and in order of age, each player chooses their own Guild.
Once the two decks "Main Deck" and "Armory Deck" have been mixed and positioned, the players choose the configuration of the Armory Board, between the two available (the dashboard is double-face). Assign the "Destiny Deck" ordered from 1 to 20 to the first player (the youngest player, or the last winner). Each player selects the Lord (Loyal) or Guardian (Traitor) of the chosen Guild and a random character from the remaining cards of the same Guild. Each players turn consist of 3 main phases, "Draw", "Play", "End of Turn".The round goes clockwise.

 In the "Draw" phase, the player must draws 2 cards from the Main Deck.
 In the "Play" phase the player has no card limits that he can play except for the Constraints (only 1 "Hit Type" card each turn, use the "Valor" ability once, can have a maximum of 4 "Equipments") in play, he can only have one weapon in play, he can use his ability and effects only once each turn),




he can draw buy and sell Armory cards.

 In the third phase "End of Turn", if the player has more than 5 cards in his hand, he discards the excess, if he has less than 5 he can decide to discard all and draw 5 new cards.




The player suffers the effects of the Poison Markers if he owns and finally fight the dragons if they are active in the game.

Goals of the Game
 The players will play with the aim of conquering the enemy Guild tokens, which are won by eliminating the characters owned by each opponents with their own cards.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Throne - I Guardiani di Kalesh è il secondo gioco di Wegas-Studios di Fabio Napolitano. 
Gioco completamente Made in Italy, rilasciato nell'Aprile del 2019.

Tema

Gioco di carte strategico fantasy medievale da 2-8 giocatori, in modalità tutti contro tutti o cooperativa. 
Throne è un gioco di duelli, tradimenti e false alleanze per contendersi l’unico Trono per il dominio del mondo. Antiche Gilde si affronteranno in epici scontri senza esclusione di Colpi, dovranno difendersi dagli attacchi di minacciosi Draghi e potranno trovare conforto con grandi bevute di buon Vino! Avrai il coraggio necessario per raggiungere la Leggendaria Kalesh e fronteggiare i suoi Guardiani? Cosa riserverà il tuo Destino? Questo dipenderà solo da te!

Game Play

A partire dal giocatore più giovane ed in ordine di età, ogni giocatore sceglie la propria Gilda di appartenenza. 
Una volta mescolati e posizionati i due mazzi "Mazzo di Gioco" e "Mazzo Armeria" i giocatori scelgono la configurazione della plancia, tra le due disponibili (la plancia è duble-fas) si assegna il "Mazzo Destino" ordinato da 1 a 20 al Capoturno (il giocatore più giovane). Ogni giocatore seleziona il Lord (Leale) o il Guardiano (Traditore) della gilda scelta e un personaggio a caso dei restanti appartenenti alla stessa gilda. I giocatori affronteranno a rotazione un turno composto da 3 fasi principali, "Pescare", "Giocare", "Fine Turno". 

 Nella fase "Pescare" il giocatore pesca 2 carte dal Mazzo di Gioco. 
 Nella fase "Giocare" il giocatore non ha limiti di carte che può giocare ad eccezione dei Vincoli (1 sola carta di "Tipo Colpo" a turno, usare 1 volta sola l'abilità "Coraggio", può avere massimo 4 "Equipaggiamenti" in gioco, può avere solo un arma in gioco, può usare abilità ed effetti una sola volta a turno), può usare l'abilità del suo personaggio, pescare vendere e acquistare carte dell'Armeria.
 Nella terza fase "Fine Turno" se un giocatore ha più di 5 carte in mano scarta quelle in eccesso, se ne ha meno di 5 può decidere di scartarle tutte e pescarne 5 nuove. 




Il giocatore subisce gli effetti dei Segnalini Veleno se li possiede e in fine affronta i draghi se sono attivi in gioco.

Scopo del Gioco
 I giocatori a turno giocheranno con l'obbiettivo di conquistare i segnalini delle Gilde nemiche, che si conquistano eliminando con le proprie carte i personaggi posseduti dagli avversari.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Rymdisar comes with a blank playing board showing a picture of space, and 14 cardboard disks to be placed out onto the board, making the playing path.

13 disks show "spacies" and they show actions such as "+2", "change 1", or "miss a turn".

One disk has a rocket, and says "Fly!"

Each player has a marker and starts with 4 gems of different colours.

Players roll a die, and move along the playing path the number of dots shown. They then need to do the action of the space they land upon. In this way, they can gain or exchange gems, until someone has 5 of the same colour.
—user summary

Take a space walk through the stars and meet friendly Spacies! Through luck and tactics, see if you can gather magical space gems. The first to collect five stones in the same colour wins.
—description from the back of the box (translated)

Ta en rymdpromenad bland stjärnorna och träffa de snälla rymdisarna! Det gäller att, genom tur och taktik, samla magiska rymdstenar. Den som först har fem rymdstenar i samma färg har vunnit.
—description from the back of the box

The Portuguese King as called the finest stonemasons of the country to pave one of the most important squares with calçada tiles (worldwide famous black and white tiles that pave several squares in Portugal).

Each player is a stonemason who will try to position his pieces on the best spots of the square in order to maximize his score...

... however, you will not only build your tiles. In fact, most of the times you will have to build other player's tiles in the square!

Players have a personal board, where they will place the tiles they collect from the quarry precisely in the order as they came out of the quarry. So when a player builds, he has the build the leftmost tile on his board and so on.

But fear not, some helpers will give a hand by breaking the game's rules. Every player starts the game with a hand of 5 helpers which they will be able to recruit during the game.

Each helper not only will bend the game's rules when activated, but they will also give points if certain types of patterns are built on the square with the player's pieces. So when you recruit a helper, you're not only building an engine of special powers but a scoring engine for the game's end.

The game constantly pitches you against the decision of when and how to build: 

 Build less to avoid building other player's pieces on the board, but you get less money and you won't be able to recruit and activate the helpers you need. 
 Build a lot but you'll probably be helping your opponent's more than you wished.




—description from the designer

In Bamses fitness game, you can collect cards by doing different moves together with Bamse and his friends. Playing games and moving around at the same time is good for both your muscles and your mind!
—description from the rulebook (translated)

Players try to collect one card in each of 5 different colours. Roll the coloured die, and if a card in the matching colour is available, do the movement shown to win the card.

Movements are things like:

 walk on your toes
 walk backwards
 lie on your stomach and fly like an aeroplane
 run around your friends
 hop like a bunny
 wriggle forwards like an eel
 stand on one leg and pinch your nose
 do a jumping jack




—user summary

I Bamses gympaspel ska du samla på kort genom att göra olika roliga gymparörelser med Bamse och hans vänner. Att spela spel och röra på sig samtidigt är bra både för kroppen och knoppen!
—description from the rulebook

Super Punch Fighter is a game of arena battle and video-game powers for 1-6 players. Choose a fighter, grab their deck, and start knocking your opponents off the stage. Each knockout earns you a star, and grabbing an achievement card earns you extra stars. The first player to reach nine stars wins!

In more detail, each turn players can use any of the button cards in front of them to gain extra movement, draw more cards, perform extra attacks, and block damage from opponents. Every time you press a button, you put a thumb token on that button card to show it's been used. You can press as many buttons as you like, but you can remove tokens from at most four cards at the end of your turn. Every other card with a thumb token still on it is then discarded, so pick your buttons wisely!

Aside from mashing buttons, you can play cards from your hand by paying the button cost of the card. Fighter cards are powerful and unique to your fighter. You can play multiple fighter cards on your turn as long as you have the buttons to pay for them, and if the last button on a fighter card matches the first button on the next card you play, you need to put a thumb token on that button only once! Pick the best cards to string together for a super-powered hit!

Super Punch Fighter includes a 1-2 co-operative mode called "Minion Rush" in which waves of minions try to overwhelm the board. Total your stars at the end to determine your rank, from lowly amateur to grand champion.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
"It is our time, WE must rise up."

In Rise of the Elder Gods players will become the gods, vying for control over their supporters - from Cultists and Acolytes, to Betrayers, Prophets and more. Controlling these weak human parasites in an effort to gather support, power and souls to feed their hunger and desire.

This beautifully creepy game for 2-6 players, taking only 30-40 minutes, will have players cheering and cursing as they compete with their sanity to outdo each other and corrupt the Investigators!
Time sensitive simultaneous action selection, "Callings" (secret objectives), "Blessing" (awards) and sacrificial Altars help players focus their strategies while providing multiple paths to victory.
With gorgeous art, and a great table presence make sure you don't lose your mind in Rise of the Elder Gods.

—description from the publisher

Statistical simulation game that allows the replay of professional darts tournaments from the 1970s through the 2000s.

Each historical player is presented with an Average Performance rating which is added to a roll of five 10-sided dice to determine who has the upper hand in the head to head match-up. Historical players also have a Tournament rating which can increase the number of dice rolled.

The higher total over three sets of rolls wins the leg, with each match being a best of 11 competition.

—user summary

A cooperative moving maze double puzzle game for 1-2 players.

Set immediately after Assembly, will you get to Earth alive?

Story:

You have escaped both the virus ridden space station and the clutches of the station’s computer. You must now make your way back to Earth in the midst of a large meteor storm but something seems to be messing with your sensors. Did you build the ship incorrectly or has the computer somehow got on board and is now trying to thwart your escape? And can you collect a sample enroute to assist with the creation of the vaccine?

—description from the publisher

A straight-forward adaptation of the card game Canasta into a word game. Instead of clustering traditional cards into melds of identical rank, lettered cards are melded into words.

The Alphanasta deck consists of two packs of 54 cards, which combined include: 40 vowels, 48 consonants, 8 doubles (e.g. J/K or W/X, where you can use it as either letter), 8 pairs (e.g. ER or ED, where both letters are used in the printed order, and 4 triples (ING). Vowels are worth 5 points each, consonants 10, doubles and pairs 20, and triples 50.

Each player is dealt 13 cards each, or 11 in partnership games. In a turn a player: 
1. Draws: either A) the top of the draw pile, or B) the entire discard pile. B) can only be done if the top discard is used to extend an existing word, or meld a new word of 4+ letters using cards from the hand. 
2. May do this as much as they wish: A) meld new words from the hand of 4+ letters; B) add cards to either end of an tabled word of theirs, making it a new word. 
3. Discards a card from the hand, unless they are going out.

Doubles, pairs, and triples are considered Wild cards for the purposes of impure words (it's impure if it ends in a Wild); and of freezing the discard pile (which cannot be drawn unless the top card is used for a new word of 5+ letters rather than 4+).

A player or team may go out if they have at least two Word Canastas (words of 7+ letters), or one Alphanasta (a word of 10+ letters played from the hand). At this point all players score the sum of the letter values in the words they have on the table, plus these bonuses: 
100 points for going out
300 an impure Word Canasta 
500 a pure Words Canasta
1000 an Alphanasta
100 for each letter over 7 in a Word Canasta.

The first player to reach 3000 points over several hands, or 5000 for partnership games, wins.

—user summary

link.value: The Valentine Publishing Co. Pty. Ltd.

item.description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: Deutschland you can use your tiles and meeples in Germany, build German cities and influence the course of important riads. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighbouring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dragons of Thruduit is an LCG game where you battle with elemental dragons!

Object of the game: in order to win you need to defeat all the opponents dragons. This can be done in any assortment of ways, but will be discussed later.

Dragons of Thruduit’s play has phases to it. 
1: draw phase
2: level phase
3: play phase
4: attack phase 
5: resolve phase
6: end phase

-Draw phase-
During the draw phase each player draws a single card. The player who goes first does not get to draw a card on their first turn.

-Level phase-
For this phase each player gains soul tokens equal to their head dragon's soul cost. You can only have a max soul count of 20. If you go above this, just take 20.
Now each player can choose to level up. If you have 10 souls then you can spend them in order to gain one level. Each player starts at level one.

-Play phase-
You may now play cards. If you wish to play a card there are a few requirements you must meet. You must be that card’s level or higher, and you must also pay that’s card soul cost. If you do both of these things then you can play the card. After you play a card, remove soul tokens from your soul pool according to the cards soul cost. Example: if you play a card that costs 5 souls, you must remove 5 soul tokens. You can only play 3 cards onto the field a single play phase.

-Attack Phase-
The first player will now attack. The player can choose any number of dragons to attack. Your dragon can only attack at an opponent’s dragon with a lower than or equal level to that dragon. Once you attack that dragon its health decreases by the attacking dragons damage value. You may attack with any number of dragons on the board as long as they can fulfill the requirements above.

-Resolve phase-
Both players now remove health counters from all their dragons that took damage this turn.

-End Phase-
Your turn ends and your opponent's turn starts.

—description from the publisher

The deck has 100 cards, each with a letter and its point value. (The letters have either a goldenrod or a turquoise background, but this has no game value.)

Each player is dealt 7 cards, and 7 more area dealt to the initial discard pile. In turn each player may discard any number of their cards and then draw that many from the deck or discard pile (but not both). This is done a second time, and then players have 60 second to form their hand into words. Players then get the point value of all the cards in the longest word they make, with a bonus of 10 points going to the best hand (typically the hand with the longest word). Hands are done until an agreed time is expired or an agreed winning point total is reached.

—user summary

The game has 72 letter cards and a 1-minute sand timer. With 4 or more players, teams of 2-3 players are recommended.

Each player (or team) is dealt 8 cards, and each player makes a word of 3 or more letters from their hand. (They may discard and draw 3 cards until they are able to make a word.)

In their turn, a player is the Word Hider, who lays out their word face down, turns the first letter face up, and starts the timer. Each other player shouts out guesses for the word. At any time before the timer runs out, if 2 or more players agree to see another letter, the Word Hider reveals another letter, and the guessing continues. Once a player correctly guesses the word, the Word Hider says "That's it" and reveals the word; the player who guessed it keeps all the cards that were hidden when the correct guess was made. If no correct guess is made, the Word Hider keeps all the letters of the word. Unclaimed cards are discarded, and Word Hider fills their hand back to 8 cards.

Players keep taking turns being the Word Hider until the deck runs out and no one can make a word from their hand. At that point, the player with the most cards won from guesses is the winner.

—user summary

Includes 200 letter cards and a sand timer.

Each player draws 16 letters face down. The timer is turned, and each player turns their letters face up, arranges them into a 4x4 grid, and moves them around to form the longest word they can find. When time runs out, if the word is valid, they keep the letters used, and the rest are returned.

After 4 rounds, the player with the most kept letters wins. Play can be varied in difficulty with more or fewer letters, or in length with more or fewer rounds.

—user summary

HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF SILVER CITY, NEW MEXICO? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Silver City we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, family attractions, and of course... world-renowned ancient cliff dwellings - a little something for every Silver City citizen! Looking for a fun way to experience the town that snard Bill the Kid?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite SIlver City properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO SILVER CITY! You may soon be the Mayor… or out of the game for eating too many New Mexico Enchiladas from the Jalisco Cafe! THIS IS SILVER CITY... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

—description from the publisher

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
Wordage has two identical decks; one deck is used for 2-4 players, both decks for 5-8 players. Each deck has: 3 A's and E's, 2 O's, I's and S's, and 1 of each other letter, all in red, and the same again all in black, plus two Joiner cards that can stand for any letter, making 68 cards. Each letter has a point value of 1-5.

Each player is dealt 14 cards (children 10 cards), and during their turn a player draws a card, lays down cards if possible, and discards a card. The initial lay-down must be one or more words that have at least 14 points in value and include at least one 5+ letter word in one color (for children, at least 10 points and no color requirement). A word's value is the sum of its letters' values, plus bonuses for length, doubled if the word is of one color.

In turns after the initial lay-down, a player may also: draw the top discard instead of the top of the deck; add letters to any word on the table instead of playing a new word (this doesn't score points, though); replace a Joiner (wild) card with the letter it currently stands from from the hand.

The player who plays all the cards in their hand except one which is then discarded, wins the round. The game is won by the first player to win two rounds consecutively; for shorter games, the consecutive requirement is dropped.

In the party version of the game, points for words played are tallied and totaled -- a score pad is included -- and a round's winner gets a bonus of 50 points plus the values of the cards left in others' hands.

—user summary

This is the word-game portion of the popular British game show. (It does not include the numbers game or the conundrum game.) It includes 22 vowel cards, 33 consonant cards, a tray, and sand timer.

During a player's turn they turn up 9 cards from the vowel and consonant decks, with the balance of vowels and consonants up to them. They then turn the timer and everyone writes down words they can form from the revealed cards, trying to come up with the longest word. When time is up, the player with the longest word scores the length of their word; tied players all score. The winner is the player with the highest score after an agreed number of rounds.

There are also rules for a Word Count Game. The mechanics are the same, but players score for every word they write down: 
1 pt - 3 letters
2 pts - 4 letters
3 pts - 5 letters
5 pts - 6-8 letters
10 pts - 9 letters
The highest score after the agreed number of rounds wins.

—user summary

This expansion brings the destructiveness of tornadoes to Age of Steam. Set in the state of Kansas, a season of tornado outbreaks across the state must be dealt with. While the effects of the tornadoes can be chaotic, proper planning and use of the Emergency Response/Forecast special action are crucial.

—description from the designer

Whoever thought that telling someone to “Go to Hell!” would be a compliment? Gather your friends and family together for a devilish dash through the fiery pits of Dante’s Inferno! Compete with your loved ones to be the first to make your way through all seven deadly sins and go to Hell. It includes one gameboard, one die, four game pieces and 20 Hell Cards! Just don't get sent to Heaven unless you have the Get Out of Heaven Free card. It's a race to the bottom that's so much fun, it's sinful!

—description from the publisher

777 questions and answers about the bible. Goal of the game is to get a complete set of cards consisting of 5 different categories and create a Picture with all of them.

—user summary

The game contains 64 cards with pictures and the corresponding words and 32 envolopes.

The kids put all cards in the envelopes so that they can only read the words. The envelopes are put face down on the table and the start player takes one envelope and tries to read the word. If he doesn't manage to, he opens the envelope and looks at the picture and let everybody else know what he sees.

Then the player can have a look at another envelope to find pairs.

—user summary
Jump and run dice game for 2-6 girls.

Loriots Spielekiste ("Loriots game box") contains two games from Loriot:

 Way to success
 Rummy with Loriot images
Short jump and run game to catch Pluto.

In FlipFlick, players will take on the role of a pancake chef as they prepare different beautiful pancake variations and yummy all-time favourites.

While cooking, the chefs will take actions and collect points for the pancakes they successfully flip. Players will make a choice of how much risk they are going to take in flipping the pancakes by flicking one, two or three pancake cards with their fingers and catching them again. Different markers on the cards indicate different levels of risk. The higher the risk, the more difficult the flip, the more points to win – and to lose, of course.

As competing chefs, players will have to interfere with their fellow co-chefs’ pancake flips and also steal their nicest creations to their advantage.

The player with the right combination of pancakes and the highest points wins.

-description from artist

Pawikan Patrol is an action-selection, light deduction strategy game set in a coastal community where players send Characters to the Beach to find the location of Pawikan (sea turtles) and their nests, while keeping the Poacher away from them. Along the way, players must also clean up Trash and make sure that the natural Predator of the sea turtles is kept safe from harm.

During a player's turn, they will choose a Character card from their hand and move it to one of the five face-down Beach cards on the Beach; in response, the Poacher card will also move to a new Beach card based on the number of arrows indicated on the Character. After moving, Beach cards in the same column as your Character and the Poacher are turned face-up at the same time: if they have the matching icon on the Beach card, they are collected; cards collected by Characters are put into their player's collection area; meanwhile, cards collected by the Poacher are discarded. If they do not have the matching icon, the cards are returned face-down.

Characters have special abilities that allow the player to gather information from the Beach or the Beach Deck, manipulate the position of cards in different zones, or negate the Poacher's ability to collect cards before you do. Players must be careful with their choice of Character to send on any particular turn, because once they move to the Beach, they have to wait they only have one Character in hand to regain the use of all their other Characters; timing their movement can be very important.

The player with the most number of points at the end of the game wins and is declared the Pawikan Patrol Leader; however, if they are they are careless enough to allow the Poacher to take away a certain number of turtles or eggs, ALL players can lose the game!

—description from the publisher

In this in-hand, cards-only solo deck management game, you are a runner who went for a morning jog in the wrong labyrinth. Now, three doors and a rampaging Minotaur stand between you and the escape tunnel at the center of the maze.

Your goal as the player is to find and discard all three door cards from the deck before you discard three Minotaur cards.

Each turn, you'll choose to uncover either the left or right side of the next card in the deck, and the side you reveal will have a symbol that tells you whether you'll need to turn the card you moved before placing it back in the deck. Then choose one of two possible locations to place the card back in the deck, and repeat with the next card until you either escape...or fall to the Minotaur.

With convenient in-hand play, simple but deep deck management, dynamically scaling difficulty, three game modes to try, and easy pausing, this is a deathtrap you'll never want to leave home without!

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
Originally conceived as a set of “large scale skirmish” rules for the Indian Mutiny, MD&E is easily adapted for other theatres and periods. These rules will easily manage skirmishes and battles between European and any native forces. The rules will even work if you want to pit a colonial German force against the French Foreign Legion, or for that matter, the British in South Africa against the Boers.

For the most part, the disparity in weapon technology offsets the fact that the Europeans are often heavily outnumbered, even though newer rifles meant superior range and firepower, in each theatre these new weapons were not universal. In fact, the British and other colonial powers often relied on locally raised allies, or levies, to do most of the fighting for them. The British had a habit of issuing local troops with weapons that were one or two developments behind their European counterparts. In far flung theatres, the replacement of seemingly obsolete weapons took some time.

The game mechanics are straightforward. All movement is randomized by using dice and you lose movement dice for bad terrain. It is easier to move and control units if there is a commander present. Firing and combat is based on the number of figures, plus or minus relevant factors. Damage either kills a figure or inflicts terror on the unit. Morale tests are triggered by extreme situations, or the gradual buildup of terror.

The rules are designed to be quick, capable of handling battles from forty or fifty figures a side to several hundred. They have worked well on a standard home-sized 10 x 6 or a monstrous 45 x 6 and have been “crash tested” by over 100 wargamers from a dozen different countries.

—description from publisher

link.value: Face Another Foe: Wargaming the Lace Wars

name.value: Face Another Foe: Wargaming the Lace Wars

item.description:
Based on the best selling MAD DOGS Indian Mutiny rules. Medium to large scale battles. Inc sample army lists and scenarios. Inc Jacobite Wars and War in the East.

—description from publisher

A standalone expansion for När då då (The Best of Chronology) with cards containing famous quotes.

Gameplay is similar to the original game. On the players turn, an opponent draws a card from the deck and reads the quote on the card. If the player successfully points out where the card should go in their current timeline, the card is added above the player Time lock and the player may then either decide to end the turn and move the cards above the time lock to the safety below it or try to get another card. If the player fails to place a card correctly, all cards gained in the current turn are lost, the turn ends and play passes to the next player.

The winner is the first player to win five cards.

When used with the original game, the cards from this game is added as another category. A new six-sided die and cardboard markers 1-6 are included to choose the category.

—user summary

A standalone expansion for När då då (The Best of Chronology) with cards containing trivia about famous buildings.

Gameplay is similar to the original game. On the players turn, an opponent draws a card from the deck and reads the text on the card. If the player successfully points out where the card should go in their current timeline, the card is added above the player Time lock and the player may then either decide to end the turn and move the cards above the time lock to the safety below it or try to get another card. If the player fails to place a card correctly, all cards gained in the current turn are lost, the turn ends and play passes to the next player.

The winner is the first player to win five cards.

When used with the original game, the cards from this game is added as another category. A new six-sided die and cardboard markers 1-6 are included to choose the category.

—user summary

GAME GOALS
Idea of game is to, through shrewd purchasing and luck, manage to survive by either bonging your self or your friends to oblivion.
RULES
BASIC EQUIPMENT The game consist of the BOARD, with space over which the player's pieces are moved. There are two DICE, TOKEN of various color , TWO sets of card for CHANCE and BOOBY-TRAP pace . There i a TITLE DEED card for every property and FOUR canister which hold the Bonging material or STASH of your choice and with this material you purchase the properties.
STARTING THE GAME Place board on table with Chance and Booby-Trap cards face down on their allotted paces. Each player is provided one colored token to represent him on his travels around the board. The bonging material or stash is used to purchase, pay penalties or rent for properties on the board. NOTE: Each player must supply their own stash and all players must begin with EQUAL amounts of STASH. Recommended for this game is at least one canister of cleaned bonging material or stash for each player. NOTE: ONE player must also supply a Bong to be used in conjunction with this game.That player is elected BONGMASTER( See Bongmaster).Each player chooses one colored token and shakes one dice. The player with the highest total start the game first. All players place their TOKE on the corner marked UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION "GO".
Upon landing on the space with his TOKEN, a player may be entitled to purchase RealEstate or other properties -or be obliged to pay bongs, pay taxes, draw a Chance or Booby-Trap card or "You Have Been Busted", etc.
If a player passes out or is unable to continue to play PRIOR to going bankrupt, all of that player's assets are divided as equally as possible by the players on each side of him.
The game is won by the last player not to go bankrupt (or pass out).

"Teachers suck.
Parents suck.
People suck.
Everything everywhere sucks.
You’re all I’ve got left."

After a traumatic event, best friends Gil and Ennis run away from home and spend six nights dreaming in the wilderness, before climbing the perilous Mount Humbaba and confronting their own personal demons. Inspired by the legends of Gilgamesh and childhood adventure films like The Goonies, The Epic of Gil & Ennis is a dice-rolling and management game for 1 or 2 players, playable in 15 minutes.

In the game, 1 or 2 players, as Gil and Ennis will move through four phases on each turn: Hike, Pitch, Sleep, and Break. In the Hike phase, they will advance to a new campsite on the map, on their way to the final Mount Humbaba space. They will make camp during the Pitch phase, manipulating their dice as they prepare for the coming night. During the Sleep phase they decide whether to dream alone or together, and will then spend dice to overcome Dream cards, gaining Insight or giving in to Worry. In the morning, they will Break camp, depleting supplies and foraging for dice. All along, players will be managing their dice through character abilities and Insights, as they try to keep the mounting Worry level at bay. Players win if they reach the Mount Humbaba space of the map and meet the dice values of the final challenge.

Played with a combination of dice and cards, the Epic of Gil & Ennis was originally an entry into the 2019 9 Card Design Contest.

-description from designer

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
Odkrywcy kultur is a game of cultural discovery that takes you around the world in just 40 minutes!

We all love to travel, explore exotic civilizations, and gain a greater understanding of the cultural heritage of others. But discovery isn’t always easy, and there’s always that chance that missteps might offend rather than open doors.

Did your host in Japan reach for her samurai sword when you plunged your chopsticks into the rice bowl? Did the guys in an English pub take a swing at you after you gestured to the bartender asking for two beers?

Odkrywcy kultur takes players to new and exciting places around the world while showing them how to behave to avoid confusion, conflicting signals, and even real danger. During the game, participants visit all continents and discover hundreds of unwritten rules of social behavior: how to gesture acceptance in India, what to avoid in Egypt during Ramadan, and how to successfully conduct business negotiations in Brazil.

Odkrywcy kultur is a unique mix of a modern board game and a handbook on cross-cultural communications. As players race to pick up souvenirs across the globe, they must think tactically to plan their trip, quiz others on potential cultural faux pas, and quickly react to opponents’ moves. As with any game, a bit of luck always helps.

When players correctly answer an opponent’s question they win chips with souvenirs and can then travel to another country, opening a treasure chest of knowledge about the new region. The game’s questions were designed and arranged to offer interesting and practical information about our “global village” during play.

The rules of Odkrywcy kultur were designed by Karol Madaj, designer of 303 as well as Kolejka (Queue) and Lukasz M. Pogoda. The questions and answers in Odkrywcy kultur were drawn from the decades of travel experience and cultural exploration of Halina Grzymala-Moszczynska, PhD, professor of Jagiellonian University in Cracow, and Witold Sekudewicz, the game’s author and managing director of The Link School of Foreign Languages and Intercultural Communications. Mr. Sekudewicz and Ms. Grzymala-Moszczynska worked closely with a panel of widely traveled experts from universities on five continents in creating the game.

Odkrywcy kultur is a must for anyone with an interest in our multicultural world and a love of sharing fun and excitement with friends and family. It’s a great pastime for both seasoned explorers and those who only dream about faraway places. Also, it is a storehouse of practical knowledge for any business traveler: Don’t risk a blunder and failed deals because you misread the signals when you’re away from home.

Before you buy your plane, train, or boat tickets, learn how to sidestep unpleasant situations and awkward apologies and avoid offending your hosts. Yes, even a journey of 10,000 miles begins with a single step. Odkrywcy kultur is the step you’ll want to take first.

—description from the publisher

link.value: The Link School of Foreign Languages and Cross Cultural Communication

item.description:
A Gentleman's War is a simple game involving toy soldiers of the classic style. It is a relaxed and relaxing game, where enough depends on the turn of a card and the roll of a handful of dice to say that our disasters are pure chance, but enough cunning decision-making to claim our victories as acts of brilliant generalship.

Our model soldiers are very brave, obedient, and generally do what we want them to. Players are expected to behave in a friendly manner, and conduct themselves as gentlemen (or ladies, as is appropriate). There are lots of six-sided dice, saving rolls, proper distances in inches, and a general sense that there ought to be salmon-and-cucumber sandwiches and tea, or
beer.

—description from publisher

A fast-paced meeple-roller where worker placement and area control strategies will keep you on top.

Lemming athletes of all stripes are teaming up to launch over the edge of competition cliffs around the world.

Your goal is to free fall and land with enough skill (and dignity) to dominate the landing field and lead your squad of furry little rodents to international victory ... go team!!

"Pay attention to landing styles ... they may save your bacon in a tiebreaker." Lois Leapworth, Red Squad Leader, Big Falls Aqua Flyers, Big Falls, B.C., Canada

Earn Achievement Trophies for squad landing formations and landing pad area control -- the squad with the most trophies at the end of the game wins!

 Download rules and PnP files here: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2177605/lemming-launcher-pnp-2019-9-card-contest-contest-r

—description from the designer

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
Build your city wherever you want! At home, on the train, on the plane. As the name says, Micro City is a small game about building your city. Several game modes, various challenges, different levels of difficulty and random distribution of districts will make each game different!

Your goal will vary depending on the mode chosen, but it’s all about building structures that you will pay for with materials gained with your actions. You only have a certain number of rounds to reach your goal, so plan every move carefully.

Micro City second edition introduces 2 completely new game modes and several changes to the base game. It’s still primarily a solitaire game but now you can also play against another player or face challenges together in a 2 or 3 player coop mode.

In Micro City you start of by rolling 2 dice. You then play on of the cards on your hand and resolve its effects. Each card causes your builder to move through the city and perform an action - either basic or an advanced one which requires a correct die. You then gain benefits from the city tile your builder ends up on. Be careful as each tile action uses one of your investment tokens and blocks that tile until the investment token is removed. Also bare in mind that you have a certain amount of time to fulfill your current objective so plan your moves wisely!

—description from the publisher

Skyline Express - the first aerial train needs a manager. Manage your carriage as best as you can by properly placing passengers, offering them services and paying attention to their individual preferences. Prove that you are the right person to manage the Skyline Express!

Skyline Express is a low enter family board game. On your turn pick a passenger from the waiting line and place him in your carriage. Sounds easy, right? Not necessarily. In order to win you need to concentrate and control the constantly changing situation on the board. Observing the actions of other players, adjusting your strategy to the current round and making sure you fill individual passengers preferences shows that becoming a manager of an aerial train is not an easy task.

The game uses familiar mechanisms such as pattern building, set collection, tile placement and action selection and merges them into a fun experience for everyone! It’s sure to appeal to fans of games such as Azul, Sagrada and Reef.

The goal of the game is to have the most victory points after 3 rounds. At the end of every round each player sums up all the points he earned in 3 different ways:
GOALS
SERVICES
VIP passengers
On his turn a player picks a passenger from the current waiting line and places him in his carriage. Additionally, the player may also use 1 of the available action slots and obtain 1 service card.

There are 6 types of passengers in the game. The white colored passenger is considered a VIP and has a specific VIP card that goes along with him. The VIP card indicates where the VIP would like to be seated and what passengers he’d like to sit with. Fulfill the VIPs preferences and earn big points!

Every round has 2 goals that give victory points if fulfilled.

For every full compartment the player receives a service token. Once the player has 2 service tokens he can then spend them to buy a service card. A service card gives victory points for every pair of passengers in the colors shown on the card.

A round ends once all passengers from the waiting room have been placed in the players carriages. Players sum up their victory points and the next round begins with new passengers filling up the waiting room. Game ends after the scoring phase of round 3. The player with the most victory points becomes the manager of the Skyline Express.

—description from the publisher

A card driven football game, with players calling plays and drawing a card to determine the outcome.

The board is cardboard, with two push pins for the 10 yard markers and one for the football.

—user summary

Nubia is a solitaire game where you rule a Black African civilization of three Christian kingdoms in the Nile Valley: Nobadia, Makuria, and Alodia. Your culture is an heir to the glories of Ancient Egypt and the legendary Kingdom of Kush, but long gone are the days when you were conquering and ruling Egypt. In the game, it is A.D. 1172 and Nubia is under siege! For 400 years, you will battle to defend civilization against the fierce pagans of the Funj, and a jihad of marauding land-hungry Arabs. Deploy your famous archers, build fortified monasteries, send the Crown Prince into battle, and marry off your daughters in a desperate effort to stem the tide.

This fast-play, fun, and educational solitaire game uses a system created by Darin Leviloff. “Mek” markers on five converging paths represent hostile Arab and pagan armies that surround your kingdoms. The paths all meet in Soba, your fabulously wealthy capital at the juncture of the Blue and White Nile rivers, where the danger of a “Collapse” exists if any of those armies makes it that far. In addition, three tracks representing medieval Nubian society (Nobility, Kingship, and the Army) greatly impact the overall situation. A card draw determines which paths and tracks move against you this turn, while the cards teach you about the history of ancient and medieval Nubia. The number of “Efforts” which you can use to move them back in your favor (if the Effort die roll succeeds) depends on the personal talents of your current Uru (king) and his chief advisor, the Metropolitan Bishop of the Coptic Orthodox Church.

Managing Efforts is key to the game, and you never have as many as you want. You can obtain more by selling off land and using your bishops for political gain instead of their natural religious calling: a short term strategy that can cost you victory points in the end. Each risky gambit is aimed at averting a system-wide social collapse, which can end the game suddenly. Your success (or failure) in holding off the five hostile armies helps determine how many noble families are still on your side when a Collapse approaches, so the better you play the game, the less chance the Collapse gets off the ground.

As the game draws to a close, the Portuguese are searching Africa for the fabled Christian “Kingdom of Prester John.” Those legends may refer to you! Can you hold medieval Nubia together long enough to make contact with them and win the game?

—description from the publisher

It’s Bath time, and this means war! Defend your Bubble Forts against your enemies as you seek to destroy theirs. Throw bubbles, seek out treasure and martial those hedgehogs as you prepare to play dirty for some good clean fun!

Aim of the Game:
Be the last duck standing by Destroying your opponents’ bubble forts. This is done by landing three bubbles on forts of the same colour.

Overview: Each player starts with a number of Bubble Forts in play and a hand of six cards. These cards are either Bubbles (which can be played on other players Forts so long as they match colour) or Treasure cards (these will be items that help you defend yourself or hinder you opponents' plays).

Players take turns playing a card from their hand, with opponents reacting with their own Treasure cards. Any time a Bubble Fort has 3 or more Bubbles on it, it pops and gives the owner extra cards to play with. But if all of your Forts are popped, you are out! The winner is the last player standing.

—description from the publisher

Chug a horn of mead, don your helm and prepare for battle in this quick paced 2-6 player game of hoofticuffs. Valhallamas begins with all players having a draft to select a combatant, a helm, a blessing and their starting hand from the three battle card decks. Place the appropriate gems on your character and prepare yourself for a llama fight.

Each round of combat begins with an initiative roll to determine who wins the first-player token. Turns move around the table as players use battle cards to kick, bite, spit and invoke Odin. Plunder the dice and gear of those who fall before you and vye to be the last llama standing.

—description from the publisher

In Doctor! Doctor!, your patient is waiting, and the other doctors aren't sure of your surgical skill. Show them who has the steadiest hand in the O.R. by completing more procedures than your competitors in this fast-paced, nerve-fraying dexterity game of concentration and operation.

Weiß Schwarz is a CCG produced in collaboration with some of the most popular animation/ video game works in Japan. Players separate the "Weiß" side which features mainly pretty characters from the "Schwarz" side featuring cool characters. Though the title consists of various kinds of card sets, a carefully planned system and rules make it possible for players to mix any of them on each side and enjoy the game.

Batman Ninja is a new series in the large Weiß Schwarz universe.

Let's Roll is a lightening fast Coop for 1-8 players.

It's from the World of Police Precinct, and is inspired by the original in many ways, but make no mistake about it, it is its own game.

Let's Roll is a fully stand-alone basegame with ALL NEW mechanics.

Each player will be a cop (play a unique character with special powers), and is a member of the task-force assigned to take down the crime family that has been terrorizing the city.

Includes 3 types of cards:
Cops
Mobsters
Events

And never seen before custom dice where the SIZE of the die intuitively tells players what to expect.

Two types:
Emergency Dice (white)
Intimidation Dice (blue)

The game clock is measured on a Crime Track, and TIME IS RUNNING OUT!

So you better finish inditing all the mobsters FAST!

Police Precinct has won recognition for its strong theme, and Let's Roll will live up to this, but with a broadened audience as it is more of a gateway game, enjoyed by gamers and non-gamers alike.

Inspired by all of the many American TV shows about Crime Fighting Police Work.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
High tempo, back and forth gameplay. A competitive roll and move football (soccer) boardgame for two players. The game may be played by two groups of people but the rules of the game are still the same.

Roll the dice and tactically choose where to move the ball towards your opponents goal. Play either a timed game or until a certain score. As in football the winner is the player with the most goals.

The board is double sided. One side is Campo: Arena for age 6+ and on the other, Campo: Stadion for ages 10+.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Test your reactions in a fast-paced game of Tetris Speed. Each card shows the next Tetrimino shape to be played. Race to play a matching card from your hand… but don’t take your eyes off the cards, or you may miss your chance!
Play all your Tetriminos to win the game.
Contents: 84 cards.

The Panjango Game is fast-moving, quick-thinking challenge game exploring the world of work. Up to six players both compete and cooperate as they complete a wide range of challenges from Tool Twister to Story Chains, and Unscramble to Disaster Plans. The winner is the player to win a set number of challenge cards.

The board comprises four different challenge piles (Question, Action, Team Play and All Play) and a spinner for the player to select the challenge. The game includes 24 challenge varieties across the four challenge types (and 242 challenge cards in total).

The box also includes a booklet with game instructions as well as 10 other mini games and information on 126 different careers. The careers information is provided as a reference point only and does not form part of the game.

The Panjango Game aims to:


 give learning context and demonstrates the exciting applications of learning in life after school 
 develop key skills such as team working, communication, problem solving, creativity and confidence 
 encourage risk taking and help young people discover their strengths and weaknesses 
 make career learning more fun and engaging through an interactive exploration of the world of work 
 open minds, broaden horizons and raise aspirations 


The game is designed for use by young people aged 8 and over either with family at home, or in the classroom.

—description from the publisher
